column1: This is an infection of an abnormal pouch (called a diverticulum) in your intestinal wall.
You may have received fluids and drugs that fight infections through an intravenous (IV) tube in your vein.
Your pain and other symptoms should go away after a few days of treatment.
Your provider may have given you antibiotics to treat any infection.

High fiber foods include: - Fruits, such as tangerines, prunes, apples, bananas, peaches, and pears - Tender cooked vegetables, such as asparagus, beets, mushrooms, turnips, pumpkin, broccoli, artichokes, lima beans, squash, carrots, and sweet potatoes - Lettuce and peeled potatoes - Vegetable juices - High-fiber cereals (such as shredded wheat) and muffins - Hot cereals, such as oatmeal, farina, and cream of wheat - Whole-grain breads (whole wheat or whole rye)
